alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 2:51PM CST until January 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conroe, The Woodlands, Oak Ridge North, Shenandoah, Cut And Shoot, Woodloch, Chateau Woods and The Woodlands Pavillion. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
